resources.string: Manage phone content from your PC
Enter this address into your PC browser
Protect your private data from unwanted observers.
Add a user-friendly name for web address
Your phone is currently connected to the AP_NAME Wi-Fi access point.

Instructions:
Make sure that your computer and your phone are connected to the same Wi-Fi access point.

Open your favourite browser on your computer (for example Internet Explorer or Firefox).

Enter the URL provided above in your browser address bar and press Enter.

The Moto Phone Portal Home page should be displayed. You may need to enter your login credentials if secure login is enabled (you can change this in the Settings menu).

Troubleshooting:
Check that the Moto Phone Portal notification icon is visible on your phone's status bar. If the icon is not displayed, it means the Moto Phone service is not running. In this case, open the application to launch the service.

Check that a URL is displayed above. If you see the Not available message, you need to enable Wi-Fi and connect your phone to the Wi-Fi network of your choice.

Check that your phone and your computer are connected to the same Wi-Fi network. The network your phone is connected to is displayed above. To determine what network your computer is connected to, open the wireless connection manager on your computer.

One-off setup:
Install the software and drivers that were included with your Motorola phone onto your Windows PC. The drivers and the MotoConnect windows tray icon application must be installed for Moto Phone Portal to operate over USB.

Connect your phone to your computer using a compatible USB cable.

Upon first connection, right click the Motorola icon visible in the Windows System Tray and select Moto Phone Portal as the default application to launch on future connections.

Disconnect and reconnect your phone to your computer. Your favourite browser will be launched automatically and will present the Moto Phone Portal Home page.
Automatic launch:\nConnect your phone to your computer using a compatible USB cable. Your favourite browser will be launched automatically and will present the Moto Phone Portal Home page.
Manual launch:\nAlternatively you can open your browser of choice and manually enter the URL displayed above to open the Moto Phone Portal Home page.
To use Moto Phone Portal, you must connect over USB or turn on Wi-Fi in Settings. Go to Settings and turn it on now?
Moto Phone Portal only runs on Motorola phones
Username and password are not enabled. Others on this Wi-Fi network may gain direct access to your content. Go to Settings and enable security now?
